sections.title: Medicaid Planning Assessment
sections.help_text: Let's explore Medicaid long-term care benefits, eligibility requirements, and planning strategies.

info_boxes.message: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Medicaid covers long-term care (nursing home, some assisted living) when private funds are exhausted. Requires meeting income and asset limits, which vary by state.

fields.label: Current Asset Position
fields.help: Position relative to state Medicaid asset limits

info_boxes.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è Medicaid asset limits: Typically $2,000-$15,000 for individuals (varies by state). Exempt assets: primary home (with equity limits), one vehicle, personal belongings, prepaid funeral. Spousal protections allow married couples to keep more assets.

fields.label: Interested in spend-down strategies?
fields.help: Learn about legal ways to reduce countable assets

fields.label: Estimated Timeline to Need Medicaid
fields.help: When you anticipate needing Medicaid LTC benefits

info_boxes.message: üí° Legal spend-down strategies: Pay off debt, home repairs/improvements, purchase exempt assets (prepaid funeral, wheelchair-accessible vehicle), convert countable assets to income (annuities with strict rules), spousal asset transfers. CAUTION: 5-year lookback period on gifts/transfers.

sections.help_text: Protecting assets and understanding Medicaid estate recovery

fields.label: Aware of Medicaid estate recovery?
fields.help: Medicaid may seek repayment from estate after death

fields.label: Interested in elder law attorney consultation?
fields.help: Elder law attorneys specialize in Medicaid planning

info_boxes.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è Medicaid Estate Recovery: After death, states must attempt to recover LTC costs from your estate. Primary home usually protected if surviving spouse, disabled/blind child, or child under 21. Trusts and strategic planning can minimize recovery.

‚úÖ Elder law attorneys can help with: Medicaid qualification strategies, asset protection, spend-down planning, spousal protections, estate recovery avoidance, trust creation, and application assistance.
